ETYMOLOGY: From Old French astronomie, from Latin astronomia, from Ancient Greek ἀστρονομία (astronomía, 'star-arrangement'), from ἄστρον (ástron, 'star') + -νομία (-nomía, 'distributing, arranging'), from νέμω (némō, 'distribute, arrange').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The scientific study of celestial objects (such as stars, planets, comets, and galaxies) and phenomena that originate outside Earth's atmosphere (such as the cosmic background radiation). It is concerned with the evolution, physics, chemistry, meteorology, and motion of celestial objects as well as the formation and development of the universe.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 研究天体（如恒星、行星、彗星和星系）以及源于地球大气层之外的现象（如宇宙微波背景辐射）的科学。它关注天体的演化、物理、化学、气象和运动，以及宇宙的形成和发展。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Galileo Galilei made significant contributions to the field of astronomy with his observations through a telescope.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 伽利略·伽利雷通过望远镜观察，为天文学领域做出了重大贡献。

REGISTER: Commonly used in academic, scientific, and general contexts when referring to the study of space.
